page.title: 08NORTHUMBRIA REGIONAL OFFICE
page.content: The Northumbria Regional Office was origanally established in what is now the Clock Tower Cafe at Wallington in May 1958.It was moved to Cambo in October 1958 and subsequently moved to Scots gap in 1977. The staff at Regional Office are responsible for administering all the Trust's properties in Northumberland ,County Durham and Tyne and Wear.The properties include,among others,Lindisfarne Castle,4 miles of Hadrian's Wall,Cragside,the Farne Islands,Washington Old Hall and Wallington. Wallington is the local estate of 13,000 acres with a fine 17th century house.It is the second largest property the Trust owns. The Trust employs 59 full-time staff in the Region,including 18 at the Regional Office and 17 on the Estate.
